title: Sell Chichibu Whisky
metaTitle: Sell Ichiro's Malt Chichibu Whisky | The First & Rare Releases | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Sell your rare Chichibu whisky. We buy Ichiro's Malt releases including The First, The Peated, On the Way, and Card Series bottles.
heroSubhead: Direct buyer for Ichiro's Malt and rare Chichibu releases.
introParagraph: Chichibu is the 'Cult' distillery of Japan. Founded by Ichiro Akuto, its small-batch releases are strictly allocated and highly collectible.
whatWeDoNotBuy: Ichiro's Malt & Grain (World Blends) - unless bulk
photoChecklist: Front label showing exact release name (e.g., 'The Peated 2013')
Back label showing bottle number (if applicable)
conditionFactors: Neck Tags: Many Chichibu releases come with a hang-tag. Missing it reduces value.
Wax Seals: Some single casks have wax tops. Cracked wax is a concern.
Labels: Chichibu labels are often textured paper which stains easily.
Box: Original box is required for full collector value.
pricingFactors: Release Rarity: 'The First' is historically significant.
Series: The 'Intergalactic' series and 'US Editions' have specific collector markets.
ABV: Cask strength releases generally command higher prices than diluted ones.
Awards: WWA winning releases often spike in value.

faqs.question: Do you buy the White Label (Malt & Grain)?
faqs.answer: We buy the 'World Blended Whisky' (blue/white label) only in volume, as it is a standard shelf item.

faqs.question: What about the 'Card Series'?
faqs.answer: Yes! The Playing Card series (Hanyu) is the holy grail. We buy individual cards or full hands.

faqs.question: Do I need the neck tag?
faqs.answer: Ideally yes. Collectors look for complete sets.

faqs.question: Do you buy US Editions?
faqs.answer: Yes, we verify the specific US release number (e.g., US Edition 2019).

faqs.question: How do you price single casks?
faqs.answer: We look at recent auction hammers and retail availability for that specific barrel number.

faqs.question: Is Chichibu a good investment?
faqs.answer: It has been one of the strongest performers in the whisky market over the last decade.
